comment: Professor Greene is a really sweet and caring teacher. Always positive and reinforces concepts learned through participation activities. Overall the class is not difficult. There is a group project and she offers many opportunities for extra credit. If I had to retake the class all over again I would choose her as the professor.

Dr. Greene really is a great Professor. Ive had her for two classes and both times had a great experience. Her classes are not difficult by any means. She is always very positive and runs her class very well, full of interactive disscusions. If it was possible i would take her every semester.

Depending on the class, she might give extra credit for attendance. Overall very nice and caring with a lot of extra credit opportunities. Tests are straight from the powerpoint and material she teaches in class. I would take her again if given the chance.

Doesn't upload the slides prior to class so it's hard to follow along during the lectures. A lot of the material is very tedious and you really have to study. She's fun and very talkative. Would take her again, but with a different curriculum bc I lowkey hated the course. Group Project, a couple of tests, and Smartbooks. Pretty basic for MGT class
I have taken professor Greene's classes twice. She is wonderful, just a bundle of joy and is so kind and caring. Too much group work is my only gripe. She is amazing!!

She is so nice, caring, and accessible outside of class. An A is manageable, but there is no quizzes/extra work to boost your grade. The tests are slightly difficult. She offers some extra credit, usually go to an event and get a correct question on the test. There is a group project with due dates throughout the semester, but it is not difficult.
Take HER!!! two group assignments, connect assignments weekly, and 4 tests. It's pretty hard not to get an A if you just put in the effort.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment:
Prof. Greene is so caring. She truly wants the best for her students. She is super energetic. 
There is a group project that is pretty easy. A few in class assignments, but no busy work/homework. 4 exams that are a little difficult. Attendance is mandatory. Offers some extra credit (go to an event, get a free correct question on an exam).

Great lectures, makes it engaging and fun, clearly knowledgeable about psychology and management. Not very many assignments, but the ones there were were pretty straightforward. Take this class if you value lectures and want to actually learn some interesting things, no matter what your major is.

She was the best professor this semester by far. We had one easy group PP project, LearnSmart and 3 easy exams. Take her online class if it's available. I'd take her again in a heartbeat if I need another MGT class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Greene is a great professor. She keeps the class engaged throughout class even though lectures may be boring. Test material comes from the PowerPointLectures. The extra credit often comes from lectures (to see who has been to class). The book is unnecessary. I got an A with some effort. Assignments are due every week. I would recommend.
Great teacher! She tries as much as possible to keep everyone involved and on topic. If you interact in class you will do so much better! She is funny and easy to get along with. Easy A!

The class is straightforward, but she makes it confusing with a ten page syllabus and goofy submission requirements. Two requirements which tripped me up are, publishing (instead of just submitting) and individual submission for group assignments.

Not bad at all, took online in summer. Was just a few points shy of an A- but only complaint, her three exams are soooo hard (nothing like the learning modules). Normal work load 1-3 hours per week, lots of little stuff-Three exams, easy group discussions, 5pt video quizes, learning modules. Definitely doable, would take her again.

I'm taking her online class right now and I wished I read some of these comments, however, I had no other 'better' choice since I could only fit this into my schedule (although online). Her test is different from the learnsmart modules and she belittles you in the e-mails with that self-righteous tone. =( unhappy student.

Prof. Greene is okay... she's definitely an odd character which can be fun and frustrating. Class was slightly confusing, lots of daily assignments and work. Tons of group work. Class was okay, I don't feel the grade I received equaled the time I invested in this class.

A somewhat offbeat teacher. Gets carried away and a bit silly at times. Hard for her to stay on track, as she is easily distracted. A fair grader. Textbook is only used for online quizzes. Teaches from Powerpoints. 4 non-cumulative tests and a group project. Find a good team!! Do the work, show up, and you should get at least a "B".

This is the worst teacher I have EVER had. I have her online. She is not helpful, her tests are ridiculous and contradicting, and if you email her she is rude and makes you feel incompetent. DO NOT take this teacher. Online weekly quizzes you can take multiple times is the only thing saving me and I am an A student. But not in this class!

Amazing teacher. She was really good at teaching. Always made the class laugh. Teat were somewhat difficult but I'm just not good at test. She makes it so you can do bad on test and still do well inthe class. Make sure do get a good group. Oh, only downfall is you cannot leave the room to pee, she will call you out.
I took her online class in the summer it was not easy. It required alot of work but the effort paid off. Test were hard so be ready.. Overall fair grading and she seems to be a nice teacher

I took this class on-line and I would not consider it easy, but if you keep up with everything and do well on exams you can make an A. Prof. Greene was very fair in grading and always willing to listen.

I love this teacher! I take her for any class I can. She is absolutely the funniest, most interesting, helpful teacher at KSU and the reason I went to clas almost every day. Amazing! Take her if you get the chance. Her classes fill up quickly.
She's nice, upbeat, and knowledgable...but class is boring and sometimes it seems as if she's speaking to the class like we're 5.  regardless, she's very helpful and intelligent

Prof Greene is probably one of the best teachers I have ever had.  I took her class at 8 in the morning and stayed awake everyday.  She always has something intersting to say that ties in with the material.  She taught me a lot about managment this semester.  I definitely recommend taking her!!
Great Professor! Has a great style of teaching the material. Very upbeat. Lots of work if you take it during summer. Exams are fair.
Easy elective. No exams!!
Professor Greene is awesome. She brings lots of energy to the classroom. Has relevent group activities to help facilitate learning. She rocks!

Professor Greene is an outstanding choice to take for any class she teaches. Her class assignments and lectures are organized and consistent. From the beginning, she clearly outlines the path to success in her class. She uses WebCT as well if not better than any professor does at KSU and as a result

great teacher. learned more than i ever imagined. she enjoys what she does and you can tell. she can relate to a lot of things, since she was in the business world for some time. i would take more of her classes if i could. tests can be tough though.
Great Professor.It was amzing how much I learned while still having fun. Her class was one worth getting up at 8:00am for.

She is a wonderful teacher and really makes the class fun. I learned so much from this course about management. Pay close attention to her test reviews (not to mention her nice booty) and this should be a great class.
